tftp

Class TFTP

  • java.lang.Object
    • tftp.TFTP

  • public class TFTP
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the necessary tools related to TFTP for the system. It includes forming different types of TFTP packets (RRQ/WRQ, DATA, ACK, and ERROR), writing to system files, and some block manipulation algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • formRQPacket

        public static java.net.DatagramPacket formRQPacket(java.net.InetAddress addr,
                                                   int port,
                                                   Request r)
        Forms a DatagramPacket using Request r with information about request type (read, write, or test), filename, and mode (ascii, octet, etc.).
        Parameters:
        addr - InetAddress of packet destination
        port - Port number of packet destination
        r - Request contains request type (READ or WRITE), filename, and mode
        Returns:
        Datagram packet for specified address and port with given request

      • formDATAPackets

        public static java.util.Queue<java.net.DatagramPacket> formDATAPackets(java.net.InetAddress addr,
                                                                       int port,
                                                                       java.lang.String filename)
        Given a filename, returns a queue of datagram packets for that file in 512 byte blocks.
        Parameters:
        addr - InetAddress of packet destination
        port - Port number of packet destination
        filename - Filename of file to read
        Returns:
        A queue of DATA packets formed from the file specificed in 512-byte chunks

      • formERRORPacket

        public static java.net.DatagramPacket formERRORPacket(java.net.InetAddress addr,
                                                      int port,
                                                      int errorCode,
                                                      java.lang.String errMsg)
        Forms a ERROR packet given the IP address, port, and details of the error.
        Parameters:
        addr - IP address of destination of the packet to be sent
        port - Port number of destination of the packet to be sent
        errorCode - Code representation of the error
        errMsg - Detailed message of the error
        Returns:
        ERROR packet formed with given inputs

      • parseRQ

        public static Request parseRQ(java.net.DatagramPacket p)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parse a given DatagramPacket p to see if it is valid. A valid packet must begin with [0,1] or [0,2], followed by an arbitrary number of bytes representing the filename, followed by a 0 byte, followed by an arbitrary number of bytes representing the mode, followed by a terminating 0 byte. If the packet is valid, a request with the respective request type, filename, and mode is created. Otherwise, an exception is thrown and the server quits.
        Parameters:
        p - Datagram packet to be parsed. Must either be a RRQ or WRQ packet.
        Returns:
        Request of the packet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • toUnsignedInt

        public static int toUnsignedInt(byte myByte)
        Overwrites the method toUnsignedInt in Class Byte since toUnsignedInt is only supported in JavaSE v1.8.
        Parameters:
        myByte - Byte representation of the number.
        Returns:
        Integer representation of the number given.
